title: [JIT] Don't support pass tuple in a PythonOp
body_html:
We could not pass tuple to a PythonOp, the interpreter will complains here for not accepting tuple.

lstm1 = nn.LSTMCell(1, 51)
h_t, c_t  = lstm1(input_t, (h_t, c_t))

Mitigate:
Wrapper func outside script func to avoid tuple being analyzed by the jit script
body_text:
We could not pass tuple to a PythonOp, the interpreter will complains here for not accepting tuple.
lstm1 = nn.LSTMCell(1, 51)
h_t, c_t  = lstm1(input_t, (h_t, c_t))

Mitigate:
Wrapper func outside script func to avoid tuple being analyzed by the jit script
body:
We could not pass tuple to a PythonOp, the interpreter will complains [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/jit/script/init.cpp#L74) for not accepting tuple. 

```
lstm1 = nn.LSTMCell(1, 51)
h_t, c_t  = lstm1(input_t, (h_t, c_t))
```

Mitigate: 
Wrapper func outside script func to avoid tuple being analyzed by the jit script
